intro: Phyllagathis nudipes, commonly known as the smooth-leafed phyllagathis, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the wet tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its simple, elliptical leaves that are typically smooth and glabrous on both surfaces. It produces small, clustered flowers that are often white or pale pink, followed by small, capsule-like fruits. Phyllagathis nudipes is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to high humidity and nutrient-rich soils.
